data.title: Falling Astronaut — Jesse Loren Strickman
data.text:
Filling up my suitcase,

Putting on my hat, tying my shoelace

Why does it feel like I’m headed to outer space?

I’m the one walking out the door

But honey, we both know you left long before

I hope you find it

I hope you find it

Hope you find what you’re looking for

I swear, a broken heart never felt so calm

Always the one to run and sound the alarm

Whether it’s my fight or my flight, I’m causing harm

But your love is like sun rays

I could be a million miles through space

I’d still feel you on my face

So I’m blasting off through the cosmos

Putting up some flags and making the most

I hope I find it

I’ll let ya know if I find it

I wonder if I’ll ever find what I’m looking for

And when I see you

It’s like I’m falling back to Earth

System failure takes me home

But the landing hurts

Past and present collide, and here we are

Without a clue what the answer is for us

But I hope we find it

I hope we find it

Hope we find what we’re looking for out there

Hope we find it

I hope we find it

‘Cause you’re the best thing I ever let go

“A superb tune to get lost into.”

- EntertainMuse Media

“Plucking the song from the cosmos we’re introduced by way of flowing, swelling harmony before being anchored by piano and strings… as waypoints of reflective songwriting keep us following the soaring message through a darkness. This single, however, is a painfully honest reflection of a real journey to find one’s self.”

- Nanobot Rock Reviews

For years I lived with a partner, we had a cat, and I played in a duo band with my bestie. All of a sudden, in what felt like one fell swoop, we broke up, our cat died, and my friend ended the band. I lost the things that filled my life each day. So I took my heartache and ventured from my hometown for the first time to start a new life, ungrounded yet excited like a space explorer. I moved off-grid to the foothills of the Sierra Nevada mountains, with no cell service or internet… Just me and my guitar for one year. What I found was a deeper connection with myself through making music. What helped my healing the most was writing “Falling Astronaut” to honor the experience of losing my love and leaving it all. I’ve learned that the more we lose, the more room is freed up to create something new.

Huge thanks to the friends and community who crowdfunded the mixing, mastering, copyrighting and distribution of this song! Thank you Dave Abercrombie, Adam Coon, Dread Pirate Ry, Sky Bennett, Eva Asher, Gabriel Keene, Miguel Serrano, Christopher Brown, All That Zazz, Talia Cooper, Ethan Gentry, Fe Esquerda, Matthew Cascardi, Renée Milligan, Daniel Langmaid, Maia Wiitala, Em Smith and Pitbull Jones! You made this song come to life <3
